result.execSummary:
The defendant Heather Marie Wienke was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant agrees to the $15.00 payment plan fee.
Payment Plan:  $50.00/month commencing on August 1, 2022

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Heather Marie Wienke

records.addlTxt: Marquette County DNA Proof of Submission

11:22 AM Prosecuting attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Heather Marie Wienke in court. 
Defendant wants to accept an offer from the State.
Atty Juech states plea agreement to Count 2.  Count 1 to be dismissed and read-in.  Defendant agrees.  Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Defendant understands and waives their right to an attorney.  Court finds waiver of attorney made freely, voluntarily & Intelligently. 

Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Defendant enters a No Contest plea.  
Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.  Court relies on the criminal complaint for a factual basis.  

BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of Count 2 and orders the judgment of conviction as of today's date. 
Count 1 to be dismissed and read-in

BY THE COURT:  Count 2:  Pay fine of $100 + costs = $579.00
Submit DNA sample within 30 days and pay surcharge 
Defendant agrees to the $15.00 payment plan fee.
Payment Plan:  $50.00/month commencing on August 1, 2022

Count 1 to be dismissed and read-in

11:32 AM Prosecuting attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Heather Marie Wienke appeared by video. 
Atty Juech states that he did not send an offer to the defendant; states the offer on the record.
Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Defendant understands and is not going to get an Attorney; she would like to accept that offer.

BY THE COURT:  Set for plea/sentencing in-person
The State will mail THE offer to the defendant.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 27, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 27, 2022 at 11:00 am.

10:50 AM Defendant Heather Marie Wienke appeared by video.  Attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading. Court advises defendant of maximum penalties.  Defendant understands. 
Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Defendant understands and waives their right to an attorney to get an offer from the State.  Court finds waiver of attorney made freely, voluntarily & Intelligently. 

BY THE COURT:  Court enters a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant. 
bond continued
Court confirms address.
Status hearing scheduled for May 23, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Status hearing on May 23, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Initial appearance on April 18, 2022 at 10:00 am.
No use or possession of any controlled substance without a valid prescription

04:00 PM Defendant Heather Marie Wienke appeared by video means from Marquette County Jail. Prosecuting Atty Clifford C. Burdon appeared for State of Wisconsin.
Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading. Court confirms address.    Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Defendant understands and may seek counsel.
BY THE COURT: Court sets bond with special conditions of no use or possession of any controlled substance without a valid prescription.  Initial appearance scheduled for April 18, 2022 at 10:00 am.
